verses.text: If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those \add things\add* which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.
Set your affection on \add things\add* above, not on \add things\add* on the earth.
For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.
When Christ, \add who is\add* our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.
Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness, which is idolatry:
for which \add thingsâ€™\add* sake the wrath of God cometh on the children of disobedience:
in the which ye also walked sometime, when ye lived in them.
But now you also put off all \add these;\add* anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.
Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;
and have put on the new \add man\add*, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:
where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bond \add nor\add* free: but Christ \add is\add* all, and in all.
Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;
forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any \add man\add* have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also \add do\add* ye.
And above all these \add things put on\add* charity, which is the bond of perfectness.
And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.
Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, \add do\add* all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.
Husbands, love \add your\add* wives, and be not bitter against them.
Children, obey \add your\add* parents in all \add things:\add* for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.
Fathers, provoke not your children \add to anger\add*, lest they be discouraged.
Servants, obey in all \add things your\add* masters according to the flesh; not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but in singleness of heart, fearing God:
and whatsoever ye do, do \add it\add* heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.
But he that doeth wrong shall receive \add for\add* the wrong which he hath done: and there is no respect of persons.
